intro: Trogostolon yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan trogostolon, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features include a woody stem and capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
